title: Zlatan Ibrahimovic announces his retirement from football
description: The 41-year-old Swedish striker bid farewell to the San Siro and football after AC Milan's 3-1 win over Verona.

title: In Russia, over 90 people arrested in demonstrations marking Alexei Navalny's birthday
description: The imprisoned Russian opposition leader is currently serving a nine-year prison sentence for fraud and contempt of court.

title: In Japan, the restitution of looted works of art is starting to be debated
description: On Wednesday, Tokyo returned a painting to Poland that was stolen in 1940 by the Nazis, while South Korea and China are also requesting the return of many works of cultural heritage.

title: Karim Benzema leaves Real Madrid after 14 years at the club
description: The legendary French striker scored a penalty in his last ever game for the Spanish club.

title: Elliot Page prepares for his next role, advocate for transgender rights
description: The first man to come out as transgender in Hollywood, the Canadian star of 'Juno' is preparing for a 'huge wave of hatred.' On June 6, the 36-year-old publishes his autobiography 'Pageboy,' at a time when the trans issue arouses fierce debate in the United States.

title: Hong Kong police detain activists on Tiananmen anniversary
description: On the anniversary of the military suppression of 1989 pro-democracy protests, activists and artists around Victoria Park in Hong Kong were detained as room for freedom of expression in the city shrinks.

title: 24 Hours of Le Mans: The forgotten story of the deadliest crash in motor racing history
description: Le Monde shares unseen archive footage shot by amateur filmmakers at the 1955 Le Mans circuit, a near-lost story of auto racing's biggest tragedy.

title: In Kashmir, authorities arm citizens to protect Hindus
description: Spared by the violence of separatist groups until now, Jammu, in the southern region of Indian Kashmir, has become a new battleground for Muslim insurgents.

title: Disney struggles to control strikes at Paris park as employees continue wage battle
description: After an initial demonstration on Tuesday, a thousand Disneyland Paris employees went on strike on Saturday, June 3. They have called for the strike to continue early next week.

title: No, Mother's Day in France was not invented by Nazi collaborator Marshal Pétain
description: The celebration of mothers, initiated in the United States, was adopted in France between the wars in an attempt to increase the country's birth rate.

title: Half a million Poles take part in anti-government protest in Warsaw
description: Protesters are accusing the government of eroding democracy and following Hungary and Turkey down the path to autocracy.

title: Wagner: What is mercenary boss Yevgeny Prigozhin after?
description: The businessman and owner of the Wagner mercenary group is no longer only attacking Russian elites. He is also questioning the official discourse on Ukraine and the military establishment, thereby implicating Putin as head of the armed forces.

title: Indian government says cause of train crash identified
description: Over 280 people were killed in a three-train crash on Friday in the eastern state of Odisha.

title: Benzema to leave Real Madrid
description: The French forward has been linked this week with a lucrative move to Saudi Arabia.

title: Is the Chinese army really ready to attack Taiwan?
description: For a decade, Beijing has strengthened all the components of its army, which Chinese President Xi Jinping has asked to prepare for an offensive. Tensions around the island have never been so high.

title: Algerian accused of terrorism caught and tried by French justice system 25 years later
description: The 55-year-old father had been living in Ireland for a quarter of a decade when he was arrested by the French judiciary. He had already been convicted in absentia in 2001.

title: Air strike kills child, injures 22 in residential area of Dnipro
description: The attack, which President Volodymyr Zelensky blamed on Russia, partially destroyed a pair of two-story buildings as well as 10 private homes.

title: Turkey's Erdogan unveils new cabinet after inauguration
description: The president has promised to serve 'impartially', days after winning re-election in a historic runoff election.

title: War in Ukraine: The Czech company fooling the Russian army with inflatable tanks
description: Inflatech, owned by a Russian businessman who lives in the Czech Republic, produces inflatable fake tanks and rocket launchers. These decoys are extremely useful for Ukrainian forces exposed to their adversary's bombardments.

title: Mexicans votes in key race ahead of 2024 presidential election
description: On Sunday, the bastion of the Institutional Revolutionary Party could pass into the hands of Mexican President Andrés Manuel López Obrador's party. A defeat would give further momentum to AMLO's presidential candidate, Claudia Sheinbaum.

title: In Montréal, one of the fathers of artificial intelligence warns of an existential threat to mankind
description: Yoshua Bengio says his struggle is like the one waged by those who for decades warned of climate change without being heard.

title: In Côte d'Ivoire, period poverty means double punishment for women in prison
description: Nothing is provided for Ivorian inmates, who lack everything from basic hygiene products to food gifts and visits, and overcrowding is prevalent.

title: 'Too much pain': the carnage of India's train crash
description: Nearly 300 people lost their lives in the three-train crash in eastern India, the worst since 1995.
